intro: Ardisia knappiae, commonly known as the Knapp's beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the island of Mindanao in the Philippines and is characterized by its small, clustered, violet-blue berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has glossy, elliptical leaves. It produces small white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by the distinctive berries that are a key feature of the species. Ardisia knappiae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
